Description: Small marl pottery vase with globular body, round base, two pierced tubular-handles at shoulder, and everted ledge-rim; the exterior is decorated with red-painted spirals of various sizes. Wavy lines are painted above one handle, with short vertical lines on the handles.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D67L in Petrie’ Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair (exterior worn), rim top worn, paint effaced, some loss of surface.
